intro: Potentilla vestita, commonly known as the white cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features small, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a distinctive five-lobed shape. Potentilla vestita thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
